meanings.definition: To search or grope about clumsily or unskillfully with the hands
meanings.sent1: She grabbled in her bag for her keys, but couldn't find them.
meanings.sent2: The child grabbled through the toy box looking for his favorite car.
meanings.sent3: He grabbled around in the dark, trying to find his misplaced glasses.
meanings.sent4: The cat grabbled at the yarn, making a mess of the knitting project.
meanings.sent5: The chef grabbled for the right spice, but accidentally knocked over the entire rack.

meanings.definition: To struggle or scramble in a disorderly way
meanings.sent1: The puppy grabbled to get out of the tangled leash.
meanings.sent2: The hikers grabbled up the steep hill, slipping on loose rocks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel grabbled across the slippery branch, almost falling off.
meanings.sent4: The children grabbled for the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent5: The team grabbled to finish the project before the deadline, working late into the night.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something in a rough or clumsy manner
meanings.sent1: She grabbled with the heavy suitcase, struggling to lift it off the ground.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic grabbled with the stubborn bolt, trying different tools to loosen it.
meanings.sent3: He grabbled with the tangled wires, trying to connect them correctly.
meanings.sent4: The toddler grabbled with the puzzle pieces, trying to fit them together.
meanings.sent5: The gardener grabbled with the overgrown bushes, trimming them back into shape.
